SEARCH
Package com.landawn.abacus.util

Class Array

java.lang.Object
com.landawn.abacus.util.Array
Direct Known Subclasses:
Array.ArrayUtil
public class Array extends Object
It is a utility class that provides various methods for array manipulation.
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • newInstance

      public static <T> T newInstance(Class<?> componentType, int length) throws NegativeArraySizeException
      Creates a new instance of an array with the specified component type and length.

      This method uses Array.newInstance(Class, int) to create a new instance of the specified array.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the array.
      Parameters:
      componentType - The Class object representing the component type of the new array.
      length - The length of the new array.
      Returns:
      The new array.
      Throws:
      NegativeArraySizeException - if the specified length is negative.

    • newInstance

      @SafeVarargs public static <T> T newInstance(Class<?> componentType, int... dimensions) throws IllegalArgumentException, NegativeArraySizeException
      Creates a new instance of an array with the specified component type and dimensions.

      This method uses Array.newInstance(Class, int...) to create a new instance of the specified array. The dimensions should be a valid int array representing the dimensions of the new array.

      Example usage: 

       
 Array.newInstance(Integer.class, 5, 5); // returns a 5x5 Integer array
 Array.newInstance(String.class, 3, 3, 3); // returns a 3x3x3 String array
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the array.
      Parameters:
      componentType - The Class object representing the component type of the new array.
      dimensions - The dimensions of the new array.
      Returns:
      The new array.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the componentType is null.
      NegativeArraySizeException - if any of the specified dimensions is negative.
      See Also:
      • Array.newInstance(Class, int...)

    • getLength

      public static int getLength(Object array) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Retrieves the length of the provided array.

      This method uses Array.getLength(Object) to determine the length of the array. The array can be an object array or a primitive array.

      Parameters:
      array - The array whose length is to be determined.
      Returns:
      The length of the array.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided object is not an array.
      See Also:
      • Array.getLength(Object)

    • range

      public static char[] range(char startInclusive, char endExclusive)
      Generates a range of characters from the start (inclusive) to the end (exclusive).

      This method generates a new char array starting from the startInclusive character up to, but not including, the endExclusive character. The characters are generated in ascending order.

      Parameters:
      startInclusive - The first character (inclusive) in the char array.
      endExclusive - The upper bound (exclusive) of the char array.
      Returns:
      A char array containing characters from startInclusive to endExclusive.

    • range

      Parameters:
      startInclusive - The first byte (inclusive) in the byte array.

      A byte array containing bytes from startInclusive to endExclusive.

    • range

      public static char[] range(char startInclusive, char endExclusive, int by)
      Generates a range of characters from the start (inclusive) to the end (exclusive) with a specific step.

      This method generates a new char array starting from the startInclusive character up to, but not including, the endExclusive character. The characters are generated in ascending order if by is positive, and in descending order if by is negative.

      Parameters:
      startInclusive - The first character (inclusive) in the char array.
      endExclusive - The upper bound (exclusive) of the char array.
      by - The step to increment (if positive) or decrement (if negative) for each subsequent character.
      Returns:
      A char array containing characters from startInclusive to endExclusive incremented or decremented by by.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if by is zero.

    • range

      public static byte[] range(byte startInclusive, byte endExclusive, byte by)
      Generates a range of bytes from the start (inclusive) to the end (exclusive) with a specific step.

      This method generates a new byte array starting from the startInclusive byte up to, but not including, the endExclusive byte. The bytes are generated in ascending order if by is positive, and in descending order if by is negative.

      Parameters:
      startInclusive - The first byte (inclusive) in the byte array.
      endExclusive - The upper bound (exclusive) of the byte array.
      by - The step to increment (if positive) or decrement (if negative) for each subsequent byte.
      Returns:
      A byte array containing bytes from startInclusive to endExclusive incremented or decremented by by.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if by is zero.

      Parameters:
      startInclusive - The first byte (inclusive) in the byte array.
      endInclusive - The upper bound (inclusive) of the byte array.
      Returns:
      A byte array containing bytes from startInclusive to endInclusive.

    • rangeClosed

      public static short[] rangeClosed(short startInclusive, short endInclusive)
      Generates a range of short integers from the start (inclusive) to the end (inclusive).

      This method generates a new short array starting from the startInclusive short integer up to and including the endInclusive short integer. The short integers are generated in ascending order.

      Parameters:
      startInclusive - The first short integer (inclusive) in the short array.
      endInclusive - The upper bound (inclusive) of the short array.
      Returns:
      A short array containing short integers from startInclusive to endInclusive.

    • rangeClosed

      public static char[] rangeClosed(char startInclusive, char endInclusive, int by)
      Generates a range of characters from the start (inclusive) to the end (inclusive) with a specific step.

      This method generates a new char array starting from the startInclusive character up to and including the endInclusive character. The characters are generated in ascending order if by is positive, and in descending order if by is negative.

      Parameters:
      startInclusive - The first character (inclusive) in the char array.
      endInclusive - The upper bound (inclusive) of the char array.
      by - The step to increment (if positive) or decrement (if negative) for each subsequent character.
      Returns:
      A char array containing characters from startInclusive to endInclusive incremented or decremented by by.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if by is zero.

    • repeat

      @Deprecated public static <T> T[] repeat(T element, int n) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Deprecated.
      prefer to repeatNonNull(Object, int) or repeat(Object, int, Class) because this method throws NullPointerException when element is null
      Generates a new array of a specified length, with all elements set to the element value. The type of the array is determined by the type of element.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the elements in the array.
      Parameters:
      element - The value to be repeated in the array.
      n - The length of the array to be generated.
      Returns:
      An array of type 'T' and length n with all elements set to element.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified element is null.

    • repeat

      public static <T> T[] repeat(T element, int n, Class<? extends T> elementClass)
      Generates a new array of a specified length, with all elements set to the element value. The type of the array is determined by the elementClass parameter.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the elements in the array.
      Parameters:
      element - The value to be repeated in the array.
      n - The length of the array to be generated.
      elementClass - The class of the elements in the array.
      Returns:
      An array of type 'T' and length n with all elements set to element.

    • repeatNonNull

      public static <T> T[] repeatNonNull(T element, int n) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Generates a new array of a specified length, with all elements set to the element value. The type of the array is determined by the type of element. Unlike the repeat(Object, int) method, this method does not throw a NullPointerException when element is null.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the elements in the array.
      Parameters:
      element - The value to be repeated in the array.
      n - The length of the array to be generated.
      Returns:
      An array of type 'T' and length n with all elements set to element.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified element is null.

      Returns:
      an array of random integers of the specified length

      • invalid reference 
        Random#nextInt()

    • random

      @Beta public static int[] random(int startInclusive, int endExclusive, int len)
      Generates an array of random integers within the specified range.
      Parameters:
      startInclusive - the lower bound (inclusive) of the random integers
      endExclusive - the upper bound (exclusive) of the random integers
      len - the length of the array to be generated
      Returns:
      an array of random integers within the specified range
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if startInclusive is not less than endExclusive
      See Also:
      • invalid reference 
        Random#nextInt(int)
      • IntList.random(int, int, int)

    • concat

      public static boolean[][] concat(boolean[][] a, boolean[][] b)
      Concatenates two 2D boolean arrays.

      This method takes two 2D boolean arrays as input and returns a new 2D boolean array which is the concatenation of the two input arrays. The input arrays are not modified during the operation.

      Parameters:
      a - The first 2D boolean array to be concatenated.
      b - The second 2D boolean array to be concatenated.
      Returns:
      A new 2D boolean array which is the concatenation of the input arrays.

      @MayReturnNull @SafeVarargs public static Boolean[] box(boolean... a)
      Converts an array of primitive booleans to an array of Boolean objects.
      Parameters:
      a - The array of primitive booleans to be converted.
      Returns:
      An array of Boolean objects, null if the input array is null.

    • box

      @MayReturnNull public static Boolean[] box(boolean[] a, int fromIndex, int toIndex) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Converts a portion of an array of primitive booleans to an array of Boolean objects.
      Parameters:
      a - The array of primitive booleans to be converted.
      fromIndex - The start index of the portion to be converted.
      toIndex - The end index of the portion to be converted.
      Returns:
      An array of Boolean objects representing the specified portion of the input array, null if the input array is null.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if fromIndex or toIndex is out of bounds.

      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if fromIndex or toIndex is out of bounds.

      @SafeVarargs public static boolean[] unbox(Boolean... a)
      Converts an array of Boolean objects into an array of primitive booleans. If a null value is encountered in the input array, it is replaced with the default value false.
      Parameters:
      a - The array of Boolean objects to be converted.
      Returns:
      An array of primitive booleans, null if the input array is null.
      See Also:
      • unbox(Boolean[], boolean)
      • unbox(Boolean[], int, int, boolean)

    • unbox

      @MayReturnNull public static boolean[] unbox(Boolean[] a, boolean valueForNull)
      Converts an array of Boolean objects into an array of primitive booleans. If a null value is encountered in the input array, it is replaced with the specified default value.
      Parameters:
      a - The array of Boolean objects to be converted.
      valueForNull - The value to be used for null values in the input array.
      Returns:
      An array of primitive booleans, null if the input array is null. see #unbox(Boolean[], int, int, boolean)

    • unbox

      @MayReturnNull public static boolean[] unbox(Boolean[] a, int fromIndex, int toIndex, boolean valueForNull) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Converts a portion of an array of Boolean objects into an array of primitive booleans. If a null value is encountered in the input array, it is replaced with the specified default value.
      Parameters:
      a - The array of Boolean objects to be converted.
      fromIndex - The starting index (inclusive) in the array to be converted.
      toIndex - The ending index (exclusive) in the array to be converted.
      valueForNull - The value to be used for null values in the input array.
      Returns:
      An array of primitive booleans, null if the input array is null.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if fromIndex invalid input: '<' 0, toIndex > a.length or fromIndex > toIndex.
      See Also:
      • unbox(Boolean[], boolean)
      • invalid reference 
        #unbox(Boolean)

      Converts a 2D array of Float objects into a 2D array of primitive floats. If a null value is encountered in the input array, it is replaced with the default value (float) 0.
      Parameters:
      a - The 2D array of Float objects to be converted.
      Returns:
      A 2D array of primitive floats, null if the input array is null.
      See Also:
      • unbox(Float[][], float)
      • unbox(Float[])

    • transpose

      @MayReturnNull @Beta public static boolean[][] transpose(boolean[][] a)
      Transposes the input 2D array.

      The transpose of a matrix is obtained by moving the rows data to the column and columns data to the rows. If the input is a matrix of size m x n, then the output will be another matrix of size n x m. This method will return null if the input array is null.

      Parameters:
      a - the 2D array to be transposed
      Returns:
      the transposed 2D array, or null if the input array is null.

    • transpose

      @MayReturnNull @Beta public static char[][] transpose(char[][] a)
      Transposes the input 2D array.

    • transpose

      @MayReturnNull @Beta public static <T> T[][] transpose(T[][] a)
      Transposes the given 2D array. The original 2D array is unchanged; a new 2D array representing the transposed matrix is returned. This method can be used to interchange the rows and columns of the 2D array.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the elements in the 2D array.
      Parameters:
      a - The original 2D array to be transposed.
      Returns:
      A new 2D array representing the transposed matrix, or null if the input array is null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the input array is not a matrix.
